svcproc.title: Disassemble Bearing Cups and Oil Seal from Hub

warning.para: Observe all warnings and cautions concerning press operation to avoid serious personal injury and possible damage to components.
Do not hit the wheel studs with a steel hammer or remove the studs by twisting. Damage to the parts can occur and metal fragments can cause serious personal injury.

note.para: If a press is not available, use a brass hammer or drift.

step1.para: If it is necessary to remove the wheel studs from the hub, place the hub in a press. Support the hub flange and press the studs through the hub.
If necessary, remove the oil seal from the hub with a suitable tool. Discard the oil seal (Figure 14).
If necessary, on units equipped for ABS, remove the ABS tone wheel from the hub with a suitable puller.
Remove the inner bearing cone from the hub (Figure 14).
Remove the inner and outer bearing cups from the hub with a press and sleeve or a bearing puller (Figure 14).
